description.narrative:
I denna promemoria föreslås att Sida fortsätter stödja refom av rättsväsendet i Kenya genom samarbete i en andra fas mellan det kenyanska rättsväsendet (Judiciary), tyska GIZ och Sverige (Sida) med programtiteln "Stöd till det kenyanska rättsväsendet inom områdena Transformering, Integritet och Ansvarsuträvande/Ansvarstagande".
Det övergripande målet för den föreslagna insatsen är att "bibehålla och fördjupa transformeringen av rättsväsendet genom strukturer för ansvarsutkrävande/ansvarstagande för att öka tillgången till rättsväsendet för befolkningen. Det föreslås att 26 miljoner mkr allokeras för reformprogrammet under perioden 15 november 2014 - 31 december 2016.

In this appraisal it is proposed that Sweden continues to support judiciary reform in Kenya through a collaboration programme between the Judiciary, Germany (GIZ) and Sweden (Sida) under the name of "Support to the Kenyan Judiciary in the Areas of Transformation, Integrity and Accountability". The overall objective for the proposed programme is to "sustain and deepen the transformation of the Judiciary through accountable structures to enhance access to and delivery of justice". It is proposed that 26 million SEK shall be allocated to the reform programme during the period 15 November 2014 - 31 December 2016.

participating-org.narrative: GIZ/Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The programme is built around three clusters of outcomes: 1. 'Structures for Change*; 2. 'Capacity for Change', and 3. 'Demand for Change'. Under the first outcome the top priority was to address and implement at least 30% the findings of the KENAO Special Audit Report of 2014 on the Judiciary. This was successfully achieved with the implementation of more than 40% of the KENAO findings. The establishment by the Judiciary of the Audit Risk Management Directorate in 2016, a directorate which is to provide independent, objective, Assurance and Consulting services to help the Judiciary to improve its effectiveness in terms of risk management, control and governance processes. Outcome 2, 'Capacity for Change - improved integrity and technical competence of judicial officers and Court staff', included the successful installations and piloting of Queue Management Systems and Public Information Centres for the High Court Registries in Milimani and Mombasa Law Courts as well as training the judicial staff in their use. The systems led to increased efficiency by allowing members of the publice to easily access information on their cases, and it led to an increase in customer satisfaction. High Court is now rolling out the same in 14 other court stations: Kisumu, Nyeri, Kisii, Machakos, Meru, Malindi, Embu, Eldoret, Nakuru, Kericho, Kakamega, Naivasha, Bungoma, and Kiambu. It is not clear when the High Court expect to have finalised the exercise. The third outcome, 'Demand for Change - constructive engagement of stakeholders with the judiciary on the transformation', includes the survey of how to support the CUCs in seven Court stations: Milimani, Makadara, Mombasa, Naivasha, Nakuru, Eldoret, and Kisumu. The survey highlighted a range of obstacles for the public, and particular vulnerable groups. This formed the basis for the continuous work that is being planned in a successor programme.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
